intro: Tylophora belostemma, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Tylophora belostemma is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional Chinese medicine.
